trans-unit.source: 3.5 (EOL in 2020-09-13, builds for 3.5 will not be provided after this)
trans-unit.target: 3,5 (EOL en 2020-09-13,las construcciones para 3,5 no se proporcionarán después de esto)

trans-unit.source: CI_BUILD. Set to 1 to emulate the CI environment build behaviour. Used only in CI builds to force certain build flags on in setup.py. Do not use this unless you know what you are doing.
trans-unit.target: CI_BUILD . Set to 1 to emulate the CI environment build behaviour. Used only in CI builds to force certain build flags on in setup.py . Do not use this unless you know what you are doing.

trans-unit.source: CMAKE_ARGS. Additional arguments for OpenCV's CMake invocation. You can use this to make a custom build.
trans-unit.target: CMAKE_ARGS . Additional arguments for OpenCV's CMake invocation. You can use this to make a custom build.

trans-unit.source: ENABLE_CONTRIB and ENABLE_HEADLESS. Set to 1 to build the contrib and/or headless version
trans-unit.target: ENABLE_CONTRIB and ENABLE_HEADLESS . Set to 1 to build the contrib and/or headless version

trans-unit.source: ENABLE_JAVA, Set to 1 to enable the Java client build. This is disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: ENABLE_JAVA , Set to 1 to enable the Java client build. This is disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: cv_major.cv_minor.cv_revision+git_hash_of_this_repo e.g. 3.1.0+14a8d39
trans-unit.target: cv_major.cv_minor.cv_revision+git_hash_of_this_repo e.g. 3.1.0+14a8d39

trans-unit.source: cv_major.cv_minor.cv_revision.package_revision e.g. 3.1.0.0
trans-unit.target: cv_major.cv_minor.cv_revision.package_revision e.g. 3.1.0.0

trans-unit.source: find_version.py script searches for the version information from OpenCV sources and appends also a revision number specific to this repository to the version string. It saves the version information to version.py file under cv2 in addition to some other flags.
trans-unit.target: find_version.py script searches for the version information from OpenCV sources and appends also a revision number specific to this repository to the version string. It saves the version information to version.py file under cv2 in addition to some other flags.

trans-unit.target: a. Packages for standard desktop environments (Windows, macOS, almost any GNU/Linux distribution)

trans-unit.source: A release is made and uploaded to PyPI when a new tag is pushed to master branch. These tags differentiate packages (this repo might have modifications but OpenCV version stays same) and should be incremented sequentially. In practice, release version numbers look like this:
trans-unit.target: Se hace un lanzamiento y se sube a PyPI cuando se empuja una nueva etiqueta a la rama maestra.Estas etiquetas diferencian los paquetes (este repo puede tener modificaciones pero la versión de OpenCV permanece igual)y deben ser incrementadas secuencialmente.En la práctica,los números de la versión de lanzamiento se ven así:

trans-unit.source: A: If the import fails on Windows, make sure you have Visual C++ redistributable 2015 installed. If you are using older Windows version than Windows 10 and latest system updates are not installed, Universal C Runtime might be also required.
trans-unit.target: A: If the import fails on Windows, make sure you have Visual C++ redistributable 2015 installed. If you are using older Windows version than Windows 10 and latest system updates are not installed, Universal C Runtime might be also required.

trans-unit.source: A: It's easier for users to understand opencv-python than cv2 and it makes it easier to find the package with search engines. cv2 (old interface in old OpenCV versions was named as cv) is the name that OpenCV developers chose when they created the binding generators. This is kept as the import name to be consistent with different kind of tutorials around the internet. Changing the import name or behaviour would be also confusing to experienced users who are accustomed to the import cv2.
trans-unit.target: A: It's easier for users to understand opencv-python than cv2 and it makes it easier to find the package with search engines. cv2 (old interface in old OpenCV versions was named as cv ) is the name that OpenCV developers chose when they created the binding generators. This is kept as the import name to be consistent with different kind of tutorials around the internet. Changing the import name or behaviour would be also confusing to experienced users who are accustomed to the import cv2 .

trans-unit.source: A: Make sure you have removed old manual installations of OpenCV Python bindings (cv2.so or cv2.pyd in site-packages).
trans-unit.target: R:Asegúrate de que has eliminado las instalaciones manuales antiguas de los enlaces de OpenCV Python (cv2.so o cv2.pyd en site-packages).

trans-unit.source: A: Most likely the issue is related to too old pip and can be fixed by running pip install --upgrade pip. Note that the wheel (especially manylinux) format does not currently support properly ARM architecture so there are no packages for ARM based platforms in PyPI. However, opencv-python packages for Raspberry Pi can be found from https://www.piwheels.org/.
trans-unit.target: A: Most likely the issue is related to too old pip and can be fixed by running pip install --upgrade pip . Note that the wheel (especially manylinux) format does not currently support properly ARM architecture so there are no packages for ARM based platforms in PyPI. However, opencv-python packages for Raspberry Pi can be found from https://www.piwheels.org/.

trans-unit.source: A: No, the packages are special wheel binary packages and they already contain statically built OpenCV binaries.
trans-unit.target: R:No,los paquetes son paquetes binarios de rueda especiales y ya contienen binarios de OpenCV construidos estáticamente.

trans-unit.source: A: Non-free algorithms such as SURF are not included in these packages because they are patented / non-free and therefore cannot be distributed as built binaries. Note that SIFT is included in the builds due to patent expiration since OpenCV versions 4.3.0 and 3.4.10. See this issue for more info: https://github.com/skvark/opencv-python/issues/126
trans-unit.target: A: Non-free algorithms such as SURF are not included in these packages because they are patented / non-free and therefore cannot be distributed as built binaries. Note that SIFT is included in the builds due to patent expiration since OpenCV versions 4.3.0 and 3.4.10. See this issue for more info: https://github.com/skvark/opencv-python/issues/126

trans-unit.source: Add custom Cmake flags if needed, for example: export CMAKE_ARGS="-DSOME_FLAG=ON -DSOME_OTHER_FLAG=OFF" (in Windows you need to set environment variables differently depending on Command Line or PowerShell)
trans-unit.target: Add custom Cmake flags if needed, for example: export CMAKE_ARGS="-DSOME_FLAG=ON -DSOME_OTHER_FLAG=OFF" (in Windows you need to set environment variables differently depending on Command Line or PowerShell)

trans-unit.target: All packages contain haarcascade files. cv2.data.haarcascades can be used as a shortcut to the data folder. For example:

trans-unit.target: All wheels ship with FFmpeg licensed under the LGPLv2.1.

trans-unit.source: Frequently Asked Questions
trans-unit.target: Preguntas frecuentes

trans-unit.source: If some dependency is not enabled in the pre-built wheels, you can also run the build locally to create a custom wheel.
trans-unit.target: Si alguna dependencia no está habilitada en las ruedas preconstruidas,también puedes ejecutar la construcción localmente para crear una rueda personalizada.

trans-unit.source: If the above does not help, check if you are using Anaconda. Old Anaconda versions have a bug which causes the error, see this issue for a manual fix.
trans-unit.target: If the above does not help, check if you are using Anaconda. Old Anaconda versions have a bug which causes the error, see this issue for a manual fix.

trans-unit.source: If you have Windows Server 2012+, media DLLs are probably missing too; please install the Feature called "Media Foundation" in the Server Manager. Beware, some posts advise to install "Windows Server Essentials Media Pack", but this one requires the "Windows Server Essentials Experience" role, and this role will deeply affect your Windows Server configuration (by enforcing active directory integration etc.); so just installing the "Media Foundation" should be a safer choice.
trans-unit.target: Si tienes Windows Server 2012+,probablemente también falten las DLLs de medios;por favor,instala la función llamada "Media Foundation" en el Administrador de Servidores.Ten cuidado,algunos posts aconsejan instalar "Windows Server Essentials Media Pack",pero éste requiere el rol "Windows Server Essentials Experience",y este rol afectará profundamente la configuración de tu Windows Server (al reforzar la integración del directorio activo,etc.);por lo tanto,sólo instalar "Media Foundation" debería ser una opción más segura.

trans-unit.source: If you have previous/other manually installed (= not installed via pip) version of OpenCV installed (e.g. cv2 module in the root of Python's site-packages), remove it before installation to avoid conflicts.
trans-unit.target: If you have previous/other manually installed (= not installed via pip ) version of OpenCV installed (e.g. cv2 module in the root of Python's site-packages), remove it before installation to avoid conflicts.

trans-unit.source: If you need contrib modules or headless version, just change the package name (step 4 in the previous section is not needed). However, any additional CMake flags can be provided via environment variables as described in step 3 of the manual build section. If none are provided, OpenCV's CMake scripts will attempt to find and enable any suitable dependencies. Headless distributions have hard coded CMake flags which disable all possible GUI dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Si necesita módulos de contribución o la versión sin cabeza,sólo tiene que cambiar el nombre del paquete (el paso 4 de la sección anterior no es necesario).Sin embargo,cualquier indicador adicional de CMake puede ser proporcionado a través de variables de entorno como se describe en el paso 3 de la sección de construcción manual.Si no se proporciona ninguna,los scripts de CMake de OpenCV intentarán encontrar y habilitar cualquier dependencia adecuada.Las distribuciones Headless tienen banderas CMake de código duro que deshabilitan todas las posibles dependencias de la interfaz gráfica de usuario.

trans-unit.source: If you still encounter the error after you have checked all the previous solutions, download Dependencies and open the cv2.pyd (located usually at C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\PythonXX\Lib\site-packages\cv2) file with it to debug missing DLL issues.
trans-unit.target: If you still encounter the error after you have checked all the previous solutions, download Dependencies and open the cv2.pyd (located usually at C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\PythonXX\Lib\site-packages\cv2 ) file with it to debug missing DLL issues.

trans-unit.source: Linux and macOS wheels are transformed with auditwheel and delocate, correspondingly
trans-unit.target: Las ruedas de Linux y MacOS se transforman con la rueda de auditoria y se deslocalizan,correspondientemente

trans-unit.source: Linux builds run in manylinux Docker containers (CentOS 5)
trans-unit.target: Las construcciones de Linux se ejecutan en contenedores Docker de manylinux (CentOS 5)

trans-unit.source: Linux wheels are built using manylinux. These wheels should work out of the box for most of the distros (which use GNU C standard library) out there since they are built against an old version of glibc.
trans-unit.target: Linux wheels are built using manylinux. These wheels should work out of the box for most of the distros (which use GNU C standard library) out there since they are built against an old version of glibc.

trans-unit.source: Manual builds
trans-unit.target: El manual construye

trans-unit.source: Manylinux wheels
trans-unit.target: Las ruedas de Manylinux

trans-unit.source: Non-headless Linux and MacOS wheels ship with Qt 5 licensed under the LGPLv3.
trans-unit.target: Non-headless Linux and MacOS wheels ship with Qt 5 licensed under the LGPLv3.

trans-unit.source: OpenCV is included as submodule and the version is updated manually by maintainers when a new OpenCV release has been made
trans-unit.target: OpenCV se incluye como submódulo y la versión se actualiza manualmente por los mantenedores cuando se hace un nuevo lanzamiento de OpenCV

trans-unit.source: OpenCV itself is available under 3-clause BSD License.
trans-unit.target: OpenCV itself is available under 3-clause BSD License.

trans-unit.source: OpenCV on Wheels
trans-unit.target: OpenCV sobre ruedas

trans-unit.source: Opencv-python package (scripts in this repository) is available under MIT license.
trans-unit.target: El paquete Opencv-python (scripts en este repositorio)está disponible bajo la licencia del MIT.

trans-unit.source: Optional: on Linux use the manylinux images as a build hosts if maximum portability is needed and run auditwheel for the wheel after build
trans-unit.target: Optional: on Linux use the manylinux images as a build hosts if maximum portability is needed and run auditwheel for the wheel after build

trans-unit.source: Optional: on macOS use delocate (same as auditwheel but for macOS)
trans-unit.target: Optional: on macOS use delocate (same as auditwheel but for macOS)

trans-unit.source: Please note that build tools and numpy are required for the build to succeed. On slow systems such as Raspberry Pi the full build may take several hours. On a 8-core Ryzen 7 3700X the build takes about 6 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Please note that build tools and numpy are required for the build to succeed. On slow systems such as Raspberry Pi the full build may take several hours. On a 8-core Ryzen 7 3700X the build takes about 6 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Python 3.x releases are provided for officially supported versions (not in EOL).
trans-unit.target: Las versiones de Python 3.x se proporcionan para las versiones con soporte oficial (no en EOL).

trans-unit.source: Read OpenCV documentation
trans-unit.target: Read OpenCV documentation

trans-unit.source: Rearrange OpenCV's build result, add our custom files and generate wheel
trans-unit.target: Reorganizar el resultado de la construcción de OpenCV,añadir nuestros archivos personalizados y generar la rueda

trans-unit.source: Releases
trans-unit.target: Comunicados

trans-unit.source: Run pip wheel . --verbose. NOTE: make sure you have the latest pip, the pip wheel command replaces the old python setup.py bdist_wheel command which does not support pyproject.toml.
trans-unit.target: Run pip wheel . --verbose . NOTE: make sure you have the latest pip , the pip wheel command replaces the old python setup.py bdist_wheel command which does not support pyproject.toml .

trans-unit.source: See the next section for more info about manual builds outside the CI environment.
trans-unit.target: Vea la siguiente sección para más información sobre construcciones manuales fuera del entorno del CI.

trans-unit.source: Select the correct package for your environment:
trans-unit.target: Selecciona el paquete correcto para tu entorno:

trans-unit.source: Select the version which you wish to build with ENABLE_CONTRIB and ENABLE_HEADLESS: i.e. export ENABLE_CONTRIB=1 if you wish to build opencv-contrib-python
trans-unit.target: Select the version which you wish to build with ENABLE_CONTRIB and ENABLE_HEADLESS : i.e. export ENABLE_CONTRIB=1 if you wish to build opencv-contrib-python

trans-unit.source: Since opencv-python version 4.3.0.*, manylinux1 wheels were replaced by manylinux2014 wheels. If your pip is too old, it will try to use the new source distribution introduced in 4.3.0.38 to manually build OpenCV because it does not know how to install manylinux2014 wheels. However, source build will also fail because of too old pip because it does not understand build dependencies in pyproject.toml. To use the new manylinux2014 pre-built wheels (or to build from source), your pip version must be >= 19.3. Please upgrade pip with pip install --upgrade pip.
trans-unit.target: Since opencv-python version 4.3.0.*, manylinux1 wheels were replaced by manylinux2014 wheels. If your pip is too old, it will try to use the new source distribution introduced in 4.3.0.38 to manually build OpenCV because it does not know how to install manylinux2014 wheels. However, source build will also fail because of too old pip because it does not understand build dependencies in pyproject.toml . To use the new manylinux2014 pre-built wheels (or to build from source), your pip version must be >= 19.3. Please upgrade pip with pip install --upgrade pip .

trans-unit.source: Since OpenCV version 4.3.0, also source distributions are provided in PyPI. This means that if your system is not compatible with any of the wheels in PyPI, pip will attempt to build OpenCV from sources.
trans-unit.target: Since OpenCV version 4.3.0, also source distributions are provided in PyPI. This means that if your system is not compatible with any of the wheels in PyPI, pip will attempt to build OpenCV from sources.

trans-unit.source: Source distributions
trans-unit.target: Distribuciones de fuentes

trans-unit.source: Starting from 4.2.0 and 3.4.9 builds the macOS Travis build environment was updated to XCode 9.4. The change effectively dropped support for older than 10.13 macOS versions.
trans-unit.target: A partir de 4.2.0 y 3.4.9 construye el entorno de construcción de MacOS Travis fue actualizado a XCode 9.4.El cambio efectivamente eliminó el soporte para las versiones de macOS anteriores a la 10.13.

trans-unit.source: Starting from 4.3.0 and 3.4.10 builds the Linux build environment was updated from manylinux1 to manylinux2014. This dropped support for old Linux distributions.
trans-unit.target: A partir de las compilaciones 4.3.0 y 3.4.10, el entorno de compilación de Linux se actualizó de manylinux1 a manylinux2014 . Esto eliminó el soporte para distribuciones de Linux antiguas.

trans-unit.source: Steps 1--4 are handled by pip wheel.
trans-unit.target: Steps 1--4 are handled by pip wheel .

trans-unit.source: Supported Python versions
trans-unit.target: Versiones de Python soportadas

trans-unit.source: Test that Python can import the library and run some sanity checks
trans-unit.target: Pruebe que Python puede importar la biblioteca y hacer algunas comprobaciones de cordura

trans-unit.source: The aim of this repository is to provide means to package each new OpenCV release for the most used Python versions and platforms.
trans-unit.target: The aim of this repository is to provide means to package each new OpenCV release for the most used Python versions and platforms.

trans-unit.source: The build can be customized with environment variables. In addition to any variables that OpenCV's build accepts, we recognize:
trans-unit.target: La construcción puede ser personalizada con variables de entorno.Además de cualquier variable que la construcción de OpenCV acepte,reconocemos:

trans-unit.source: The default manylinux images have been extended with some OpenCV dependencies. See Docker folder for more info.
trans-unit.target: The default manylinux images have been extended with some OpenCV dependencies. See Docker folder for more info.

trans-unit.source: The master branch follows OpenCV master branch releases. 3.4 branch follows OpenCV 3.4 bugfix releases.
trans-unit.target: La rama maestra sigue los lanzamientos de la rama maestra de OpenCV.La rama 3.4 sigue los lanzamientos de correcciones de errores de OpenCV 3.4.

trans-unit.source: The packages include also other binaries. Full list of licenses can be found from LICENSE-3RD-PARTY.txt.
trans-unit.target: The packages include also other binaries. Full list of licenses can be found from LICENSE-3RD-PARTY.txt.

trans-unit.source: The project is structured like a normal Python package with a standard setup.py file. The build process for a single entry in the build matrices is as follows (see for example appveyor.yml file):
trans-unit.target: The project is structured like a normal Python package with a standard setup.py file. The build process for a single entry in the build matrices is as follows (see for example appveyor.yml file):

trans-unit.source: There are four different packages and you should select only one of them. Do not install multiple different packages in the same environment. There is no plugin architecture: all the packages use the same namespace (cv2). If you installed multiple different packages in the same environment, uninstall them all with pip uninstall and reinstall only one package.
trans-unit.target: There are four different packages and you should select only one of them. Do not install multiple different packages in the same environment. There is no plugin architecture: all the packages use the same namespace ( cv2 ). If you installed multiple different packages in the same environment, uninstall them all with pip uninstall and reinstall only one package.

trans-unit.source: These artifacts can't be and will not be uploaded to PyPI.
trans-unit.target: Estos artefactos no pueden ser y no serán subidos a PyPI.

trans-unit.source: These packages do not contain any GUI functionality. They are smaller and suitable for more restricted environments.
trans-unit.target: Estos paquetes no contienen ninguna funcionalidad GUI.Son más pequeños y adecuados para entornos más restringidos.

trans-unit.source: Third party package licenses are at LICENSE-3RD-PARTY.txt.
trans-unit.target: Third party package licenses are at LICENSE-3RD-PARTY.txt.

trans-unit.source: Use twine to upload the generated wheel to PyPI (only in release builds)
trans-unit.target: Usar cordel para subir la rueda generada a PyPI (sólo en las construcciones de lanzamiento)

trans-unit.source: Versioning
trans-unit.target: Versionado

trans-unit.source: Windows N and KN editions do not include Media Feature Pack which is required by OpenCV. If you are using Windows N or KN edition, please install also Windows Media Feature Pack.
trans-unit.target: Windows N and KN editions do not include Media Feature Pack which is required by OpenCV. If you are using Windows N or KN edition, please install also Windows Media Feature Pack.

trans-unit.source: Wrapper package for OpenCV python bindings.
trans-unit.target: Paquete de envoltura para las fijaciones de pitón de OpenCV.

trans-unit.source: You can also force pip to build the wheels from the source distribution. Some examples:
trans-unit.target: You can also force pip to build the wheels from the source distribution. Some examples:

trans-unit.source: You'll have the wheel file in the dist folder and you can do with that whatever you wish
trans-unit.target: You'll have the wheel file in the dist folder and you can do with that whatever you wish

trans-unit.source: run pip install opencv-contrib-python-headless if you need both main and contrib modules (check extra modules listing from OpenCV documentation)
trans-unit.target: run pip install opencv-contrib-python-headless if you need both main and contrib modules (check extra modules listing from OpenCV documentation)

trans-unit.source: run pip install opencv-contrib-python if you need both main and contrib modules (check extra modules listing from OpenCV documentation)
trans-unit.target: run pip install opencv-contrib-python if you need both main and contrib modules (check extra modules listing from OpenCV documentation)

trans-unit.source: run pip install opencv-python-headless if you need only main modules
trans-unit.target: run pip install opencv-python-headless if you need only main modules

trans-unit.source: run pip install opencv-python if you need only main modules
trans-unit.target: run pip install opencv-python if you need only main modules

trans-unit.source: source distributions are separate entries in the build matrix
trans-unit.target: las distribuciones fuente son entradas separadas en la matriz de construcción

trans-unit.source: tests are disabled, otherwise build time increases too much
trans-unit.target: las pruebas están deshabilitadas,de lo contrario el tiempo de construcción aumenta demasiado

trans-unit.source: there are 4 build matrix entries for each build combination: with and without contrib modules, with and without GUI (headless)
trans-unit.target: hay 4 entradas de matriz de construcción para cada combinación de construcción:con y sin módulos de contribución,con y sin GUI (headless)
